decks.notes: This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast a powerful storm spell like Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. It uses cards like Rite of Flame, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress. The deck's card draw and selection spells help to find the right combo pieces at the right time. With careful planning and timing, this deck can win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this Control-Loam deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources using cards like Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and Chalice of the Void, while also generating card advantage and recurring key threats with Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire. The deck also aims to control the board with powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant, as well as disrupt the opponent's game plan with Abrupt Decay and Liliana of the Veil. The deck's engine revolves around using Loam to continuously recur lands and generate value.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible by utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt opponents' strategies and protection from counterspells is provided by Cavern of Souls. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer to quickly close out games. With a strong mana base and efficient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early in the game and maintain pressure throughout.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain control over the game by using a combination of disruption spells like Daze and Stifle, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to apply pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler while also utilizing powerful cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Deathrite Shaman to generate card advantage and outmaneuver the opponent. The mana base is designed to support all three colors of the deck and provide flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and trigger powerful effects from cards like Bridge from Below. By consistently dredging through the graveyard and utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Cabal Therapy, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and generate value from sacrificing them. The deck aims to win through a combination of graveyard recursion, token generation, and disruption through discard effects.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through a combination of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes graveyard interaction with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to dominate the game through efficient removal, card advantage, and disruption, ultimately winning through incremental advantage and resource denial.

This deck focuses on consistently getting out big, game-changing creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn as quickly as possible through the combo of Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Intuition to protect the combo and ensure it goes off smoothly. With the ability to cheat out powerful threats early in the game, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a decisive manner.

This deck focuses on swiftly deploying aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. By combining powerful creatures with efficient spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain control throughout. With a strong mana base consisting of Wasteland and dual lands like Island','','');">Volcanic Island, the deck can quickly adapt to various threats and strategies, ensuring a fast-paced and dynamic gameplay.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards and efficient creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while taking control of the game. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure, the goal is to establish control of the game and out-value the opponent. Cards like Liliana of the Veil and Swords to Plowshares provide additional control elements, while cards like Lingering Souls and Dark Confidant provide card advantage and resilience.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible, utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to find and play the necessary pieces. Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Pithing Needle and Not of This World protect the combo. The deck also includes ways to generate additional mana with Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide, as well as ways to protect the combo pieces like Vampire Hexmage. The goal is to quickly create a 20/20 Marit Lage token and win the game.

The main concept of this Legacy Control - Stoneblade deck is to control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's strategy using cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Counterspell. The deck also focuses on card advantage and card selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. By utilizing powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to put pressure on the opponent, supplemented by equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, this deck aims to outvalue and outsmart the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently controlling the board. It utilizes powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Baleful Strix, and Deathrite Shaman to generate card advantage and target the opponent's resources. The deck also includes a range of removal spells like Fatal Push, Kolaghan's Command, and Lightning Bolt to handle threats and maintain board control. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to outvalue the opponent through efficient card selection, disruption, and removal spells.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to establish early control through removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, counter spells like Force of Will and Counterspell, and card draw manipulation with cards like Predict and Brainstorm. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain board advantage and stabilize the game. Monastery Mentor provides additional threats while Snapcaster Mage allows for spell recursion. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the necessary spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruption and card advantage. By using cards like Hymn to Tourach, Thoughtseize, and Kolaghan's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage with Brainstorm, Snapcaster Mage, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the deck has a versatile removal package with cards like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay, allowing it to deal with a variety of threats efficiently.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 flying indestructible creature. This combo can be searched for using cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying, while protection spells like Not of This World and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress help ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Pithing Needle can also shut down opposing strategies, while cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide help accelerate the deck's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through the use of Elves and various mana-producing cards, such as Gaea's Cradle. This mana is then used to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Ruric Thar, the Unbowed, or to search for them with cards like Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also includes cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and get extra value out of them, while also utilizing Glimpse of Nature to draw additional cards and keep the combo going.
